title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Remote Greek culture has been a genetic ‘island’ for 4500 years
items.description: New DNA analysis links Deep Maniots to Greece’s premedieval past

items.title: Historic U.S. marine lab parts ways with the University of Chicago
items.description: After a 12-year affiliation intended to address financial woes, the Marine Biological Laboratory returns to independence

items.title: Controversial Danish vaccine research group faces new allegations
items.description: Researchers say they couldn’t find complete data for 10 trials that together enrolled tens of thousands of children in Guinea-Bissau

items.title: These beetles wear chemical ‘invisibility cloaks’—and will die if they’re removed
items.description: Coatings used by symbiotic residents of ant colonies may represent an evolutionary dead end

items.title: Imagination isn’t just for humans, this famous ape shows
items.description: Kanzi, a bonobo studied for his language skills, understood make-believe objects

items.title: FDA-approved drug may address a major cause of infertility
items.description: Finerenone boosts ovary function in mice and appears to help people with primary ovarian insufficiency produce mature eggs

items.title: A hack-proof internet? Quantum encryption could be the key
items.description: Team in China sends data with entangled atoms, neutralizing backdoor hardware threats

items.title: Sharp cutbacks in field tests could threaten quality of 2030 U.S. census
items.description: Efforts to correct historic undercount of poor, immigrant, rural, and minority populations are at risk, critics say

items.title: Inside the quest to make a safer football helmet
items.description: New energy-absorbing designs and materials have revolutionized the iconic safety device

items.title: Space dust reveals rapid evolution after dino-killing asteroid
items.description: New data detail how tiny forms of life rebounded much more quickly than previously believed
